name: rb_raventools
tagline: An unofficial ruby wrapper for the RavenTools SEO API.  Requires an account with RavenTools and an API Key.
body:
# Working with RavenTools:

[Generating a RavenTools API Key](https://raven.zendesk.com/entries/243600-raven-api)

[RavenTools API Documentation](https://api.raventools.com/docs/)



# Using rb_raventools

## Installation

Add this line to your application's Gemfile:

    gem 'rb_raventools'

And then execute:

    $ bundle

Or install it yourself as:

    $ gem install rb_raventools


## Setup

Once 'rb_raventools' is in your project, simply setup a RavenTools api client:

```ruby
    client = RavenTools::Client.new("INSERT_YOUR_API_KEY")
```

and from there, you can perform method calls like:

```ruby
    domains = client.domains
```

or specify options / parameters such as:

```ruby
    keywords = client.keywords("DOMAIN_NAME", { format: "xml" })
```

# Methods

## Domains

To find all domains connected to a particular account (as defined by the API Key), simply use:


```ruby
    domains = client.domains
```


This method does not require additional parameters or options.

#### Sample Response

Output will be an array of strings, containing all domains available.


```ruby
    # domains = client.domains
    ["example1.com", "sub.example1.com", "example2.org"]
```
